DataElement.preferredDefinition: Information related to a score regarding a pathologic grading system used to evaluate the tumor response to preoperative chemotherapy and radiation.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A pathologic grading system used to evaluate the tumor response to preoperative chemotherapy and radiation._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A pathologic grading system used to evaluate the tumor response to preoperative chemotherapy and radiation.

Concepts.definition: A pathologic grading system used to evaluate the tumor response to preoperative chemotherapy and radiation.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having determined the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 7/2/2020: CM Released; 6/25/2020: CM versioned to 2.0 per New MDR migration add Property task.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality. A pathologic grading system used to evaluate the tumor response to preoperative chemotherapy and radiation._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

PermissibleValues.value: No viable cancer cells (complete response - score 0)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.: Response; a bodily process occurring due to the effect of some foregoing stimulus or agent.

Concepts.definition: To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.
Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent.

PermissibleValues.value: Single cells or rare small groups of cancer cells (near complete response - score 1)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not far distant in time or space or degree or circumstances.: To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.: Response; a bodily process occurring due to the effect of some foregoing stimulus or agent.

Concepts.definition: Not far distant in time or space or degree or circumstances.
To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.
Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent.

PermissibleValues.value: Extensive residual cancer with no evident tumor regression (poor or no response - score 3)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Of low value or worth.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: The non-affirmative response to a question.: Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent.

Concepts.definition: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent.

PermissibleValues.value: Residual cancer with evident tumor regression, but more than single cells or rare small groups of cancer cells (partial response - score2)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Partial; being or affecting only a part; not total: Response; a bodily process occurring due to the effect of some foregoing stimulus or agent.

Concepts.definition: Being or affecting only a part of something.
Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A pathologic grading system used to evaluate the tumor response to preoperative chemotherapy and radiation.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A pathologic grading system used to evaluate the tumor response to preoperative chemotherapy and radiation.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
